item.title: Set up the Tutorial on GitHub
item.description: To do the tutorial exercises interactively you will need a GitHub account. If you are not ready to setup a GitHub account and run workflows, a ’take-a-look’ repository with the exercise issues and pull requests is available at take-a-look. You can follow along with the tutorial and read the issues and pull requests without having to run your own GitHub actions. Skip head to the exercises. For those working through the exercises, this setup guide will take you though forking the tutorial, enabling issues, setting read and write permissions for workflows, and switching on workflows.

item.title: Create the Exercises
item.description: There are two GitHub workflows for the tutorials. create_exercises creates the exercises. reset_exercises clears the exercises so you can start afresh. Workflows # To get to the workflows, click the Actions tab Create the Exercises # To create the exercises, click create_exercises from the menu on the left Then click Run workflow which will bring up a pop up menu: Choose the Language exercises. Text creates review exercises that do not require any code knowledge.
